video.title: Learn the Svelte JavaScript Framework - Full Course
video.description:
Full Course on the Svelte JavaScript Framework.

⭐️ Code / Projects ⭐️
Handwashing App
  🔗 https://phptuts.github.io/fcc-handwashing/
  🔗 https://github.com/phptuts/fcc-handwashing
COVID-19 US Tracker App
  🔗 https://covid-us.noahglaser.net/
  🔗 https://github.com/phptuts/fcc-covid-19-us
Project Estimator App
  🔗 https://phptuts.github.io/fcc-project-estimator-svelte/
  🔗 https://github.com/phptuts/fcc-project-estimator-svelte
Tictactoe App
  🔗 https://phptuts.github.io/fcc-tictactoe-svelte/
  🔗 https://github.com/phptuts/fcc-tictactoe-svelte

✏️ Created by by Coding With Noah: https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCjWnee4Cv1MESU8ALLsHdCA

⭐️ Course Contents ⭐️
⌨️ (00:01:02) What is svelte
⌨️ (00:01:25) What is Sapper
⌨️ (00:01:49) Svelte Demo
  🔗 REPL Demo: https://svelte.dev/repl/856a0501186742b2b2446fd720271ed4?version=3.20.1
⌨️ (00:07:41) What we are building
⌨️ (00:10:48) What you will need
  🔗 https://nodejs.org/en/
  🔗 https://git-scm.com/
  🔗 https://github.com
  🔗 https://code.visualstudio.com/
  🔗 https://marketplace.visualstudio.com/items?itemName=JamesBirtles.svelte-vscode
⌨️ (00:11:36) Installing Svelte
⌨️ (00:12:56) Clean up + tour
⌨️ (00:16:46) Installing CSS
  🔗 https://www.npmjs.com/package/rollup-plugin-css-only
  🔗 https://blueprintcss.dev/docs/grid

npm install blueprint rollup-plugin-css-only --save-dev

@import url('https://fonts.googleapis.com/css2?family=Lato:wght@900&display=swap');
body {
  font-family: 'Lato', sans-serif;
}

⌨️ (00:25:15) Components & HTML
  🔗 https://www.who.int/gpsc/clean_hands_protection/en/
⌨️ (https://)freesound.org/people/metrostock99/sounds/345086/
⌨️ (00:42:06) Timer Component & Reactive Variables
⌨️ (00:55:39) Playing Sound & Custom Events
⌨️ (01:02:32) Github Pages

npm install gh-pages --save-dev

⌨️ (01:06:41) What is Sapper
  🔗 https://sapper.svelte.dev/
⌨️ (01:07:31) What we'll be using to build covid-19 US Tracker
  🔗 https://covidtracking.com/
  🔗 https://bulma.io/
  🔗 https://www.chartjs.org/
  🔗 https://momentjs.com/
  🔗 https://github.com/axios/axios
⌨️ (01:08:52) Tour of the app
  🔗 https://covid-us.noahglaser.net/
⌨️ (01:10:49) Project Setup / Sapper Tour
⌨️ (01:20:48) Project Cleanup
⌨️ (01:25:21) NPM Install + Bulma Setup

npm install bulma rollup-plugin-css-only chart.js moment --save-dev
npm install --save axios

⌨️ (01:31:09) Page & Components
⌨️ (01:41:24) NavBar
  🔗 https://bulma.io/documentation/components/navbar/
⌨️ (01:51:39) About Pages + Titles
  🔗 https://bulma.io/documentation/layout/section/
⌨️ (01:58:55) Getting data from an api
⌨️ (02:13:51) Populating CovidStat component with data
  🔗 https://covidtracking.com/api
⌨️ (02:21:22) Error Page
⌨️ (02:24:51) CovidStat data for the states
⌨️ (02:45:30) Requesting & Parsing Chart Data
  🔗 https://charturl.com/app/examples/chartjs-timeseries
⌨️ (03:04:32) Covid Chart Component
⌨️ (03:21:39) Covid Chart State Component + Fixing Chartjs Errors
⌨️ (03:33:29) Request Data For States Table Component
⌨️ (03:41:48) Table Component
⌨️ (03:49:31) Filtering Table Component
⌨️ (04:12:03) Deploying Sapper
  🔗 https://www.digitalocean.com/docs/networking/dns/how-to/add-domains/
  🔗 https://www.digitalocean.com/community/tutorials/how-to-install-nginx-on-ubuntu-18-04
  🔗 https://certbot.eff.org/
  🔗 https://pm2.keymetrics.io/
⌨️ (04:29:25) Final Touches + Redeploy
  🔗 https://sapper.svelte.dev/docs/#prefetch_href
⌨️ (04:40:53) Project Estimator Introduction
⌨️ (04:41:44) Writable Store Demo
  🔗 https://svelte.dev/examples#writable-stores
⌨️ (04:45:36) Project Setup
  🔗 https://sscaffold-css.com/
⌨️ (04:52:01)  Component Setup
⌨️ (04:56:28) Form Components
⌨️ (05:12:27) Writable Stores
⌨️ (05:21:13) Table Component
⌨️ (05:32:52) Edit Item
⌨️ (05:43:31) Remove Item
⌨️ (05:50:31) Github Pages
⌨️ (5:53:50 )Fixing Bugs and Redeploying
  🔗 https://github.com/sveltejs/svelte/issues/4687
  🔗 https://github.com/sveltejs/svelte/pull/4689
⌨️ (06:01:44) Svelte Amazing Community
⌨️ (06:03:00) Readable Stores Example
  🔗 https://svelte.dev/examples#readable-stores
⌨️ (06:05:53) Challenge Create HTML & CSS & Props
⌨️ (06:17:55) Node Server Tour
  🔗 https://github.com/phptuts/tictactoe-server
  🔗 https://chrome.google.com/webstore/detail/smart-websocket-client/omalebghpgejjiaoknljcfmglgbpocdp?hl=en-US
  🔗 https://www.postman.com/
⌨️ (06:26:34) Readable Store
⌨️ (06:46:23) Websock
⌨️ (06:58:14) New Game
⌨️ (07:02:19) Deploying TicTacToe To Github
⌨️ (07:06:20) Other Resources and Libraries
  🔗 https://svelte.dev/tutorial/basics
  🔗 https://svelte.dev/examples#hello-world
  🔗 https://routify.dev/
  🔗 https://bestguy.github.io/sveltestrap/
  🔗 https://smeltejs.com/
  🔗 https://sveltematerialui.com/
  🔗 https://discordapp.com/invite/yy75DKs
  🔗 https://www.reddit.com/r/sveltejs
  🔗 The Return of 'Write Less, Do More' by Rich Harris: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=BzX4aTRPzno
  🔗 Rich Harris: Thinking Reactively: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=AdNJ3fydeao
⌨️ (07:09:38) Congrats you completed the course

topLevelComment.author: Noah Glaser
topLevelComment.text: Hello, I am the YouTuber who created this video.  If anyone has any questions let me know. I am happy to help.  Just reply to this comment.  Thank you.

replies.author: Noah Glaser
replies.text: @Kurt Fisher I don't think you can do that because they require node js

topLevelComment.author: Fighter Life
topLevelComment.text:
My hwa and c19 both cannot output extra.css file. I think it may be due to the version's difference of some packages.
Is there anyone having problem about the output extra.css file? any who know how to fix it?

replies.author: KSKSKS
replies.text: @Fighter Life Thank you! Had the same problem, couldn't figure it out. This works.

replies.author: Fighter Life
replies.text:
just to remove all the node_modules, change the package.json's  to  be "rollup-plugin-css-only": "^2.0.0" and then run the "npm install", then it becomes perfect. 
I am just a newbie. Haha

topLevelComment.author: Matheus Justino
topLevelComment.text: I'm interesting in this course, but I'm Brazilian. I speak a little English. Could you make subtitles available even if they are automatically generated? Thanks!

topLevelComment.author: Mike Engledew
topLevelComment.text:
This is one of the best learning experiences (free or paid) I have experienced, just the right amount of challenge exercises to force me to learn; without making things so hard they are not fun!
I also like that we're not just creating another todo list, these are great example apps that will help jump start the application I want to create.
Thank you Noah!!
... P.S. if you were to update your course to use Sveltekit, I would do it all again (assuming I can get past the issue I mentioned in a reply to ASY below). ;-)

topLevelComment.author: Nivedha Kr
topLevelComment.text: I would like to know if karma and jasmine can be used for testing and have you also written any tests that could help me with that.

topLevelComment.author: Aytaç
topLevelComment.text: Hello, I could not implement bulma css files with roll-up. I changed "rollup.config.js" file but extra.css is creating under the __sapper__ /static folder not main "static" folder. I see 404 code near the "extra.css" file in console. It can't load clean. What should I do?

replies.author: chris James
replies.text: anyone figure this out?

replies.author: Mike Engledew
replies.text: Yep, I have the same problem, the extra.css file isn't being created in the covid sapper tutorial, I have tried several things so far but have been unsuccessful. I didn't have the same issue in the first svelte tutorial though... very frustrating. So far I have tried using the same package.json file as the tutorial thinking that an updated package broke it, but it didn't help.

topLevelComment.author: EyeInTheSky

topLevelComment.author: Kokizzu
topLevelComment.text: no autogenerated cc/subtitle '__')

topLevelComment.author: Avana Vana
topLevelComment.text:
Literally seven hours of a guy typing “covid” and “svelte” but saying “CORVID” and “SWELT” every time.  As useful as this video is, after the four-dozen the time it was excruciating to listen to.  Like a form of water torture.  

A “corvid” is a type of crow-like bird.  “Covid” is the disease caused by coronavirus (e.g. Covid-19 is caused by SARS-CoV-2 coronavirus).  “Svelte” means thin, attractive, lithe, light... “swelt” means to die or be oppressed by terrible heat.   I think “svelte” fits the library better than “swelt”...  the latter is like some kind of reverse German accent.

topLevelComment.author: Eugene
topLevelComment.text: 4:09:47 We should not use replace() here. In different locales, it will not work. We should sort states' data as numbers and parse them into locale strings in Table.svelte only.

topLevelComment.author: John D
topLevelComment.text:
Please help me out here,

I am new to programming, and i want to buy a course for JavaScript but now i saw list of courses:

1. JavaScript Bootcamp
2. JavaScript Bible

Please which one must i buy....? 

Thanks

replies.author: CT-5555
replies.text:
@John D yes. I'm learning c right now but i first check youtube and read books. 
Then I go to paid options if i need to. But usually learning free from the web is enough.

replies.author: John D
replies.text: @Eugene so, you mean its better for free courses first then later I can decide on the course to buy

replies.author: Eugene
replies.text:
Neither? Programming is about finding a solution. If you cannot find free beginner courses for yourself, you will be a bad programmer.

P.S. Andrew Mead is kinda cool though. His Gatsby Bootcamp was fun

topLevelComment.author: Sebastián Scarano
topLevelComment.text:
I noticed that you work on the master branch, and when done you checkout the new branch from master

wouldn't be a better git practice to create the feature branch before actually starting to work on the feature? moreover, you can merge local branches from vscode (but not from the "..." menu), withouth having to push and pull from the remote repo

replies.author: Noah Glaser
replies.text: You are right about that.  That's is a better way of doing things.

topLevelComment.author: Elgiz Hacıyev
topLevelComment.text: is it html and css course? why you didnt make templates before the recording?

replies.author: Noah Glaser
replies.text: @Elgiz Hacıyev That's a good point.  I am thinking about it.

replies.author: Elgiz Hacıyev
replies.text: anyway thanks for course

replies.author: Elgiz Hacıyev
replies.text: @Noah Glaser but i think its waste of time to watch html and css parts who already know html and css and just want to learn svelte

replies.author: Noah Glaser
replies.text: It has a lot of HTML and CSS in it.  I wanted to show what it's like to code the HTML and CSS in the svelte.

topLevelComment.author: Nor Priest
topLevelComment.text:
What the hell is Svelt?
Damn man I thought C#, Python, JavaScript, PHP, Html&CSS are enough to save my life.
I swear there are like too many stupid languages that keep coming up every 3 months.
We're living in mad times 😂
It's like we live our lives with no real purpose anymore. Just keep coding like robots.
We're getting closer and closer to be robots.
Do we code to live anymore?
Or it's the opposite?

replies.author: L C

1. It’s Svelte
2. It’s not a language
3. Evolution is generally accepted as a way to progress society, chiselling in stone is not so popular these days
4. You could stick with PHP, if that’s your thing 

Problem solved 👍🏻
